alert.note: Alert for Boone; Hendricks (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 14 at 2:00PM EDT by NWS Indianapolis
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of central Hendricks and south central Boone Counties through 230 PM EDT... At 200 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 6 miles northwest of Brownsburg to near Danville. Movement was southeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Danville around 205 PM EDT. Plainfield around 210 PM EDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include Brownsburg. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
